intro: Microtropis tenuis, commonly known as slender microtropis, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, palmate leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Microtropis tenuis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
